titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Mildred Stead Capron papers, 1931-1972
titlestmt.author: Processed by John Waggener

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Shaun Hayes December 2010

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Mildred Stead Capron papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: The Mildred Stead Capron Papers contain the adventure documentary films she created. Included are related materials including production files, research notes, publicity, and photographs.

bioghist.head: Biography of Mildred Stead Capron
bioghist.p: Mildred Stead Capron (1899-1978) was a photographer, author, and member of the Society of Women Geographers, 1955-1978. Her publications included: "Wyoming Indians, Describing the Work of the Episcopal Church in Wyoming amongst the Shoshone and Arapaho Tribes" (1944) and "Prayers at Christmas" (1944). After arriving in Wyoming in 1935, she lived on the Arapaho Reservation. She lived in Moose, Wyoming in Teton County where she operated Capron Film Productions on the Murie Ranch. She corresponded with the noted photographer, Maragaret Bourke-White, 1963-1971. She was a friend of Mardy and Olaus Murie, noted Wyoming conservationists whose views she shared.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Mildred Stead Capron Papers consist of the 16mm adventure documentary films she made during the 1950s and 1960s. The areas she documented in the United States include Wyoming, Alaska, and the Chesapeake Bay. International sites include Ireland, Brittany in northwest France, Portugal, the islands of Azores and Madeira, Spain, and South Africa. Also included are the film production files. These include scripts, research notes, subject files, photographs and negatives, and advertising for her documentaries. The collection also includes a small amount of biographical material and some of her personal photographs. Most of the photographs relate to Wyoming landscapes and wildlife in the areas of the Snowy Range, the Wind River Range, Jackson Hole, the National Elk Refuge, the Teton Mountains, and wild horse roundups in the Red Desert. Other photographs relate to sheep shearing, a pow wow on the Wind River Indian Reservation, and outdoor recreation scenes.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Mildred Stead Capron at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from Mildred Capron (1970-1971), Donald Murie (1978), and the Murie Center of Moose, Wyoming (2004, 2006).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by John Waggener in November of 2010. New material was added by D. Claudia Thompson in April 2017
Portions of the collection were digitized by Halena Bagdonas in February 2012, Rick Walters in February 2012, and Kathy Gerlach in April 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of select material from this collection are available at http://digitalcollections.uwyo.edu:8180/luna/servlet/uwydbuwy~95~95.

did.unittitle: Series I. Biographical Information and Personal Notes

scopecontent.p: This series includes biographical material, personal notes, and photographs of Mildred Capron. The material is contained in one folder.

did.unittitle: Series II. Production Files

scopecontent.p: This series contains the production files for Capronâ€™s 16mm films. Included are script notes, technical data, research notes, subject files, advertising and publicity, and photographs and negatives of the sites she visited. The files are arranged alphabetically by title of film.

Series III. Photographs

scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs taken by Mildred Capron. Most of the photographs are of Wyoming landscapes, wildlife, and outdoor recreation. Some images are of her world travels.

Series IV. Motion Picture Films and Audiotapes

scopecontent.p: This series contains the full-length feature films produced by Capron. Additionally, film clips, short takes, and audio reel-to-reel tapes used in the making of her films are included. Some audio relates to music on the Wind River Indian Reservation.

unittitle.extref: 16mm motion picture film (short-takes, and film clips for her productions)
